content: Hi all, I am running a self-hosted Zulip instance and was wondering if it is possible to "move" users from the basic email+password authentication to an SSO based authentication, without disturbing the user's history and conversations.

@Pranav Ashok Sure, these things are independent. Zulip identifies the user account based on the email address obtained during authentication. So you can switch to any other auth method, and as long as Zulip gets the email address matching the existing account, that's what the user will get logged in as

Thanks @Mateusz Mandera! And I believe in case I want to change the email while switching the SSO, then I should first get the users to change their email using this and then do the switch. Does that sound like it should work?
@Pranav Ashok Yes exactly, that's the way to go
